result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:08 PM Defendant Timothy W Pittman in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Timothy W Pittman.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a bail modification in this matter and states reasons on the record. 
State objects to any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Court denies any bail modification at this time for reasons stated on the record.

10:37 AM Defendant Timothy W Pittman in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Timothy W Pittman.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties request another status date to see if defendant has been picked up. Time expires 11-14-22. Atty Gutierrez requests time limits be considered.
Extradition hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Extradition hearing on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant for Commitment signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on September 12, 2022

8:54 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Defendant Timothy W Pittman in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Timothy W Pittman. 
Atty Gutierrez states they are contesting the extradition in this matter. 
State requests a 60 day extension and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Gutierrez objects to the extension and states reasons on the record. 
Court denies any bail modification and states reasons on the record. 
Court will extend period for 60 days. 
Court sets a hearing date.
Extradition hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Extradition hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:16 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Timothy W Pittman in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Timothy W Pittman. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading. 
State of Iowa is requesting extradition for 719.4(3), Voluntary Absence from Custody, a serious misdemeanor and a Department of Corrections warrant for escape from custody on Domestic Abuse- assault- 2nd offense; Willful Injury-Causing Bodily Harm; Robbery- 2nd Degree, 85% and Theft 2nd Degree.
Court Conducts Waiver of Extradition Colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant contests the extradition.
The State gives its bail recommendation.
The Defense gives its bail recommendation.
THE COURT REMANDS THE DEFENDANT INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Extradition hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
